manage.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it
manage.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He was asked to manage a new department.
Managing a football team is harder than you think.
The company had been very badly managed.
a brewery which has been owned and managed by the same family for over 100 years
manage.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to succeed in doing something difficult, especially after trying very hard
manage.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Juventus managed two goals in the last ten minutes.
I don’t know how I’ll manage it, but I’ll be there.
I finally managed to push the huge animal away.
How do you manage to stay so slim?
We somehow managed to persuade him.
manage.translation[0].definitions[1].not: In written English, people often use succeed in doing something rather than manage to do something, as it sounds more formal:
At a time of depression, Roosevelt succeeded in restoring hope.
manage.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to succeed in dealing with problems, living in a difficult situation etc
manage.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
We didn’t have the proper equipment, but we managed somehow.
How do you manage without a washing machine?
I can’t afford to get you a new coat – you’ll have to manage with the one you’ve got.
manage.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to use your time, money etc sensibly, without wasting it
manage.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Paying a little each month can help you manage your money.
You need to learn to manage your time more effectively.
Consultants can help academic institutions to manage their resources more efficiently.
manage.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to succeed in buying the things that you need in order to live even though you do not have very much money
manage.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: I honestly don’t know how we’ll manage now Keith’s lost his job.
It’ll be tight, but I guess I’ll just about manage.
People like Jim have to manage on as little as $75 a week.
manage.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to be able to do something or carry something without help
manage.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: Can you manage all right, Mum?
You’ll never manage that suitcase; let me take it.
Thank you, but I think I can manage perfectly well on my own.
manage.translation[0].definitions[6].def: to succeed in keeping something neat and tidy
manage.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: He’ll never manage such a big garden on his own.
manage.translation[0].definitions[7].def: to control the behaviour of a person or animal, so that they do what you want
manage.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: It’s hard to manage your children and do the shopping.
The horse was huge and vicious. Giles was the only one who could manage her.
manage.translation[0].definitions[8].def: to be able to do something because you are strong enough or healthy enough
manage.translation[0].definitions[8].exa: He tried to walk, but managed only a few shaky steps.
manage.translation[0].definitions[9].def: to be able to eat or drink something
manage.translation[0].definitions[10].de: to do something that causes problems – used humorously
manage.translation[0].definitions[10].ex: Andrews has managed to get himself sacked.
I don’t know how I managed to arrive so late.
manage.translation[0].definitions[11].de: to be able to meet someone or do something, even though you are busy
manage.translation[0].definitions[11].ex: ‘Is there any chance you could work late?’ ‘I think I could manage an hour.’
manage.translation[0].note_box[0].items[: that you manage something or just that you manage
You can also use succeed on its own
manage.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to direct or control a business, part of a business, or the people who work in it
manage.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: He will be managing a staff of about 1,500.
The unions had undermined the employers’ ability to manage.
manage.translation[1].definitions[1].def: if a financial institution manages someone’s money, it decides when and where to invest it
manage.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: investors who use trading advisers to manage their money in futures markets
